parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.57</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns all mission objects (created by or during a mission) with given type (or its subtype). In some cases [[allMissionObjects]] could be substituted with [[entities]], which would be much much faster alternative. Some of the unusual mission objects that can be detected with this command (as well as with [[nearestObject]]):
* <tt>"#slop"</tt> - blood drop
* <tt>"#mark"</tt> - unit footprints
* <tt>"#track"</tt> - vehicle tracks
* <tt>"#crater"</tt> - explosion crater on the ground
* <tt>"#crateronvehicle"</tt> - bullet marks on vehicle
* <tt>"#explosion"</tt> - an explosion
* <tt>"#objectdestructed"</tt> - building, tree or bush destruction
* <tt>"#soundonvehicle"</tt> - sound created with [[say3D]] for example
* <tt>"#dynamicsound"</tt> - sound source created using [[createSoundSource]]
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''allMissionObjects''' type </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> type: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[Object|Objects]]</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_airObjects = [[allMissionObjects]] "Air";</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>{ [[deleteVehicle]] _x } [[forEach]] ([[allMissionObjects]] "");</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_allMObjects =[[ allMissionObjects]] "All";</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>  [[allDead]], [[allGroups]], [[allUnits]], [[entities]], [[vehicles]], [[allMines]], [[allSimpleObjects]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 22, 2012
<dt class="note">[[User:Rocket|Rocket]]
<dd class="note">Be VERY careful with the use of this command. It is very demanding as it must iterate through all mission created objects. Particular care should be taken exercising this often on dedicated servers.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on Decembere 15, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">For some reason in Arma 3 this command is up to 5 times faster on the dedicated server than on a connected client. In my experiments it took on average 5 ms for the command to complete on a client while under 1 ms on the server.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
